definitions.definition: force (something unwelcome or unfamiliar) to be accepted or put in place.
examples: the decision was theirs and was not imposed on them by others
synonyms: land someone with "he imposed his ideas on the art director"

definitions.definition: require (a duty, charge, or penalty) to be undertaken or paid.
examples: levy, charge, apply, enforce; Moreset, establish, institute, introduce, bring into effect "new taxes will be imposed"Moreset, establish, institute, introduce, bring into effect new taxes will be imposed
the director was unable to impose himself on the production

definitions.definition: take advantage of someone by demanding their attention or commitment.
examples: she realized that she had imposed on Miss Hatherby's kindness
synonyms: be a burden on; informalwalk all over "it was never my intention to impose on you"

definitions.definition: arrange (pages of type) so that they will be in the correct order after printing and folding.
